thread.title: France train hero stabbed in CA
thread.title_full: France train hero stabbed in CA - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: RNN Staff
title: France train hero stabbed in CA
text:
SACRAMENTO, CA (RNN) - A U.S. serviceman who was stabbed foiling an attack aboard a French train has been stabbed again.
Spencer Stone reportedly was stabbed early Thursday morning around midnight. An Air Force spokesman said he is in stable condition, the Air Force Times reported.
According to ABC 10 in Sacramento , Stone was stabbed several times in the torso outside a bar.
He is expected to survive, though homicide detectives initially were called to the scene because of the severity of Stone's injuries, ABC 10 said.
The police are looking for one suspect and are not treating this as a hate crime.
This is the area where the stabbing occurred. @ABC10 pic.twitter.com/ipQGTzhoJe
â€” Hayley Guenthner (@ABC10Hayley) October 8, 2015 Stone, an Air Force Airman 1st Class, was one of three men who stopped a gunman from opening fire on a train in France in August.
Stone was stabbed while responding to that incident and was the most seriously injured of the three, cut in the hand with a box cutter.
Spencer was on vacation on Aug. 21 with his friends, Army Spc. Alek Skarlatos of the Oregon National Guard and Anthony Sadler when the train attack occurred aboard the Amsterdam-to-Paris train.
The three was able to restrain the heavily armed assailant in an alleged terror attack.
In recognition of their actions, the men were honored by both French and U.S. presidents for their actions. French President Francois Hollande awarded them the Legion d'Honneur.
Stone received the Purple Heart and the Airman's Medal.
The city of Sacramento also honored with a parade in their honor in Septemeber
